comments:
I have a file something.sql and using the IDE to edit it. In the preferences *.sql is associated with 'SQL File Editor (default)'.

After I modified the content, I tried to save it but no changes is written to the file. I check file date and it is the same as the old one, i.e., it was never changed by the SQL File Editor in Eclpse
Who wrote this SQL File Editor?

Unable to repro with the following test environment:

Eclipse 3.3
EMF-SDO-XSD SDK 2.3
GEF 3.3
DTP 1.5 SDK
Windows XP SP2
Sun JVM 1.5

Created a sql file, added contents, saved, closed, re-open --> contents as expected.

Can you provide some details about your environment? Also, I notice that the version number for DTP is set to 0.7 -- is this right?

Finally, a failure of this type likely would leave a stack trace in the .log file (workspace/.metadata/.log): can you see if anything is present there?

(In reply to comment #2)
> Unable to repro with the following test environment:
> 
> Eclipse 3.3
> EMF-SDO-XSD SDK 2.3
> GEF 3.3
> DTP 1.5 SDK
> Windows XP SP2
> Sun JVM 1.5
> 
> Created a sql file, added contents, saved, closed, re-open --> contents as
> expected.
> 
> Can you provide some details about your environment? Also, I notice that the
> version number for DTP is set to 0.7 -- is this right?
> 
> Finally, a failure of this type likely would leave a stack trace in the .log
> file (workspace/.metadata/.log): can you see if anything is present there?
> 

I created a path in my web application. Call the root path as /Something and I put my file under it /Something/AFile.sql

I am using linux, so the above web path is in /home/me/workspace/Something/AFile.sql

Here is the log:

Hung, Hui:

Linux issue, or something about web applications?

Hi

Here this problem occurs when I open a file which is not in the eclipse project workspace with File -> Open File...

I edit the file, the change indicator on the editors left sidebar is highlighted, I save -> the save-icon is disabled but the file was not saved.

Environment:

eclipse.buildId=I20070625-1500
java.version=1.6.0_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_AT
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

no logs in .log

Of course the file type is .sql ;)
after saving the highlighting is not removed
I've reproduced this problem for external sql files on windows XP. I'll fix it by 1.6M5.
